verses.kjv: Now Naaman, captain of the host of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honourable, because by him the LORD had given deliverance unto Syria: he was also a mighty man in valour, but he was a leper.
verses.ct: Naaman, the commander of the Syrian king's army, was a highly respected and honored man in his master's court, because through him the LORD had given victory to Syria. He was a powerful warrior, but he had leprosy.

verses.kjv: And the Syrians had gone out by companies, and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid; and she waited on Naaman’s wife.
verses.ct: During one of their raids, the Syrians had captured a young girl from the land of Israel, and she became a servant to Naaman's wife.

verses.kjv: And she said unto her mistress, Would God my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria! for he would recover him of his leprosy.
verses.ct: She told her mistress, "I wish my master could go see the prophet in Samaria! He could cure him of his leprosy."

verses.kjv: And one went in, and told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel.
verses.ct: Someone went and reported to Naaman, "This is what the girl from Israel said."

verses.kjv: And the king of Syria said, Go to, go, and I will send a letter unto the king of Israel. And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment.
verses.ct: The king of Syria said, "Go ahead, and I'll send a letter to the king of Israel." So Naaman left, bringing with him 10 talents of silver, 6,000 pieces of gold, and 10 sets of clothing.

verses.kjv: And he brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying, Now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have therewith sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy.
verses.ct: He delivered the letter to the king of Israel. It read: "When you receive this letter, know that I am sending my servant Naaman to you so that you may cure him of his leprosy."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he rent his clothes, and said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy? wherefore consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh a quarrel against me.
verses.ct: When the king of Israel read the letter, he tore his clothes in grief and said, "Am I God, with the power to kill and bring back to life, that this man is asking me to cure someone of leprosy? Think about this carefully — he's clearly trying to pick a fight with me!"

verses.kjv: And it was so, when Elisha the man of God had heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.
verses.ct: When Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, he sent word to the king: "Why have you torn your clothes? Send him to me, and he will learn that there is a prophet in Israel."

verses.kjv: So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariot, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha.
verses.ct: So Naaman arrived with his horses and chariot and stopped at the entrance of Elisha's house.

verses.kjv: And Elisha sent a messenger unto him, saying, Go and wash in Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come again to thee, and thou shalt be clean.
verses.ct: Elisha sent a messenger out to him, saying, "Go wash yourself in the Jordan River 7 times, and your skin will be restored, and you will be healed."

verses.kjv: But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said, Behold, I thought, He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the LORD his God, and strike his hand over the place, and recover the leper.
verses.ct: But Naaman was angry and walked away, saying, "I expected him to come out personally, stand before me, call on the name of the LORD his God, wave his hand over the infected area, and cure the leprosy."

verses.kjv: Are not Abana and Pharpar, rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage.
verses.ct: "Aren't the Abana and Pharpar rivers in Damascus better than any body of water in Israel? Couldn't I wash in those and be healed?" So he turned around and stormed off in a rage.

verses.kjv: And his servants came near, and spake unto him, and said, My father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee, Wash, and be clean?
verses.ct: But his servants approached him and said, "Sir, if the prophet had told you to do something difficult, wouldn't you have done it? How much easier is it when he simply tells you, 'Wash, and be healed'?"

verses.kjv: Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God: and his flesh came again like unto the flesh of a little child, and he was clean.
verses.ct: So he went down and submerged himself in the Jordan 7 times, just as the man of God had instructed. His skin was restored and became like that of a young child, and he was healed.

verses.kjv: And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him: and he said, Behold, now I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee, take a blessing of thy servant.
verses.ct: Then he went back to the man of God with his entire entourage, stood in front of him, and said, "Now I know for certain that there is no God anywhere on earth except in Israel. Please, accept a gift from your servant."

verses.kjv: But he said, As the LORD liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take it; but he refused.
verses.ct: But Elisha replied, "As surely as the LORD lives, the one I serve, I will not accept anything." Naaman pressed him to take it, but he refused.

verses.kjv: And Naaman said, Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to thy servant two mules’ burden of earth? for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Then Naaman said, "If you won't accept a gift, then please let your servant take home as much earth as 2 mules can carry. From now on, your servant will never again offer burnt offerings or sacrifices to any other god except the LORD."

verses.kjv: In this thing the LORD pardon thy servant, that when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my hand, and I bow myself in the house of Rimmon: when I bow down myself in the house of Rimmon, the LORD pardon thy servant in this thing.
verses.ct: "But may the LORD forgive your servant for this one thing: when my master goes into the temple of Rimmon to worship there and leans on my arm, and I have to bow down in the temple of Rimmon — when I bow down in the temple of Rimmon, may the LORD forgive your servant for this."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way.
verses.ct: Elisha told him, "Go in peace." So Naaman left and had traveled a short distance.

verses.kjv: But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said, Behold, my master hath spared Naaman this Syrian, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought: but, as the LORD liveth, I will run after him, and take somewhat of him.
verses.ct: But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, thought to himself, "My master let Naaman the Syrian off too easily by not accepting what he brought. As surely as the LORD lives, I'm going to run after him and get something from him."

verses.kjv: So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he lighted down from the chariot to meet him, and said, Is all well?
verses.ct: So Gehazi chased after Naaman. When Naaman saw someone running toward him, he stepped down from his chariot to meet him and asked, "Is everything all right?"

verses.kjv: And he said, All is well. My master hath sent me, saying, Behold, even now there be come to me from mount Ephraim two young men of the sons of the prophets: give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver, and two changes of garments.
verses.ct: Gehazi answered, "Everything is fine. My master sent me to say, 'Just now, 2 young men from the company of prophets have arrived from the hill country of Ephraim. Please give them a talent of silver and 2 sets of clothing.'"

verses.kjv: And Naaman said, Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of garments, and laid them upon two of his servants; and they bare them before him.
verses.ct: Naaman said, "Please, take 2 talents." He insisted, then tied up 2 talents of silver in 2 bags along with 2 sets of clothing and gave them to 2 of his servants, who carried them ahead of Gehazi.

verses.kjv: And when he came to the tower, he took them from their hand, and bestowed them in the house: and he let the men go, and they departed.
verses.ct: When Gehazi reached the hill, he took the items from the servants and stored them inside the house. Then he sent the men away, and they left.

verses.kjv: But he went in, and stood before his master. And Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou, Gehazi? And he said, Thy servant went no whither.
verses.ct: He went inside and stood before his master. Elisha asked him, "Where have you been, Gehazi?" He replied, "Your servant didn't go anywhere."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Went not mine heart with thee, when the man turned again from his chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and oliveyards, and vineyards, and sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and maidservants?
verses.ct: But Elisha said to him, "Wasn't my spirit right there with you when the man got down from his chariot to meet you? Is this the time to accept money, clothing, olive groves, vineyards, sheep, cattle, and male and female servants?"

verses.kjv: The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cleave unto thee, and unto thy seed for ever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.
verses.ct: "Because of this, Naaman's leprosy will cling to you and to your descendants forever." Gehazi left Elisha's presence with leprosy — his skin white as snow.
